comments:
I dont have extra information about this problem  but this is what the defect
owner asked me to document in a bugzilla defect

I have a Web project named Web1 I rename the WebContent folder in the project to
Web1 (right click web project Properties->Web Project Features)

Now I use Data->SQL wizard to connect to a database and create a SQL statement.
This wizard stores database information in the web project
It usually stores it in Web1/WebContent/WEB-INF/databases folder
but after I rename WebContent to Web1 the wizard fails to store the database
information 

apparently some emf class called PassthruResourceSet
"This is a more generic problem.  The reason for the NPE is that 
the database documents get created in the incorrect location.
The URI that is passed to the PassthruResourceSet.createResource()
is correct  (ie. web1/web1/WEB-INF/databases/sample.dbxmi)
However, the resource that gets created is put in web1/web1/web1/WEB-INF/databases/
This seems to be a problem with either EMFWorkbench or the web nature.
"
 <Note by ramanday (Mandayam, Rajasimhan A.), 2003/04/06 13:35:21, seq: 1 rel: 0
 action: open>
BUILD 0331 W2 WSAD

Select web project say 'Web1', go to Properties->Web and change its Web Content
folder name to 'Web1' itself.

Now launch Data->SQL stmt wizard.

Connect to default db2 db and hit finish. wizard doesnt go away.

error in stack trace.

    <Note by joan (Joan Haggarty), 2003/09/10 16:51:00, seq: 7 rel: 0  action:
assign>
This is a more generic problem.  The reason for the NPE is that 
the database documents get created in the incorrect location.
The URI that is passed to the PassthruResourceSet.createResource()
is correct  (ie. web1/web1/WEB-INF/databases/sample.dbxmi)
However, the resource that gets created is put in web1/web1/web1/WEB-INF/databases/
This seems to be a problem with either EMFWorkbench or the web nature.
Thanks. Joan.
Old Component: wsa.etools.rsc.sqlbuilder
New Component: wsa.web.tooling

    <Note by jcagle (Cagle, J.E. (Jay)), 2003/09/19 14:52:44, seq: 9 rel: 0 
action: return>
Raj, can you open a Bugzilla defect against EMF for this.  Thanks.

Raj,

PassthruResourceSet is not an EMF component. Nor is EMFWorkbench, for that 
matter.  These are extensions written in WSAD and you need to find the right 
owner for those.
